Video and photos are excellent and the Video is at Blu-ray quality and is verrrrrry impressive. If you record in Blu-ray format it takes approx one gig for 30 minutes. It consumes approx 10% of the battery for 30 minutes of video5. Add on cute flash6. Speed is awesome, camera takes continuous snaps with no hesitation.7. Good features to get best picture qualityCons:1. BIGGEST PROBLEM: There is a overheating problem with the unit when you record video, I tested this thoroughly before writing it, I recorded 30 minutes with a thermos symbol in the middle of the screens but still completed 30 minutes recording, but the unit seemed to get hot enough so you can feel the heat to the stem of the lens body. After 30 minutes I recorded again and the camera shuts down under 10 minutes. I repeated these steps like 10 times to ensure I do the burning test before I return it. Also I did notice that when you move the lcd up from the body to give it a air vent it minimized the overheating issue but didn't solve the problem. There are several postings on the web about this issue but there is no solution with firmware or Sony addressing it. I haven't called the Sony service yet.2. Stock lens that comes with the camera (18 to 55) does not have good zoom, maybe 4x compared with pocket cameras, again this point is based on the point and shoot users perspective but you can get 18 to 220 lens if you really need zoom.3. Flash gets in the way when you adjust zoom mainly focus adjustment is ok.4. I wish the video is in MPEG or AVI format to get a DVD quality, which is better than MP4 format.5. Too many settings in different places and it takes really a good hands on practice sessions to get to know the camera.6. Doesn't come with a pouch or bag.7. Features or functions navigation via rotary or other buttons is not great. Sony should have created a custom mode where you can save all your settings.Bottom line, it is a great camera but may not be a camcorder replacement even thought it takes greeeeeat videos. It is good for the guys trying to upgrade from point and shoot to SLR's and take advantage of SLR capabilities but still can use it like point and shoot camera.Once I talk to Sony I will post an update on the overheating issue.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Parks
Reviews.Content: I've been an amateur photographer for about 20 years.  I swore I would never switch to a digital camera.  I have previously used a few point-and-click digital cameras; however, for any serious photography, I never left my trusty 35mm and my negative scanner.  However, I have finally been converted.  I bought this camera for a mountain-climbing trek several months ago.  I needed a high quality camera that would be as light and small as possible, as we were hiking for a week at about 16k feet, and I knew that every additional ounce would matter.  Also, I occasionally produce wall-size prints from my shots, so it was important that the camera have a large sensor and high image quality. For the image quality, size and price, I doubt you can beat this camera.  In fact, I would say the image quality is overkill for the sporadic family photographer.I've bought a number of the accessories and particularly prefer the 16mm lens with occasional fisheye converter.  I find it a little small for my hands; however, if it fit my hands, it would not have fit my size requirements for the trip.  I intend to upgrade to the NEX-7 when it is released.

Reviews.Title: I Shoulda Married This Camera
Reviews.Author: D. Albert
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera the night before my wedding and had it in my hands at 9AM the next morning, but that's not what's important. I was using this thing for the first time during my honeymoon and it was crazy awesome.My full setup was Dolica WT-1003 67-Inch Lightweight Monopod, Vista Explorer 60-Inch Lightweight Tripod with Tripod Bag, Professional Mini Ball Head Camera Mount, and Lowepro Edit 100 Camcorder Bag (Black).It takes a little learning to find where all the settings are (very little is done via physical controls) but the camera is very helpful. It actually has documentation in the camera - a help button you can select and popups that explain every setting you select. You can use the touchscreen or the physical dial/buttons for just about anything, your choice. I find I generally prefer the physical controls which let me use the thumb of my right hand as I am gripping the camera, but the touch screen option comes in handy more often than I thought it would. Also the ability to touch a spot on the screen and have it focus on that is very nice. I had a Canon G12 10 MP Digital Camera with 5x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.8 Inch Vari-Angle LCD for a month before this one and I do not miss it (Canon's G series has tons of dedicated physical controls which are handy for learning photography via experimentation).Comparison to Canon G12:I was unsure of this purchase at first because comparison images from this camera and the Canon G12 on sites like dpreview.com didn't indicate a clear winner, despite the Sony's 8.5x larger sensor and bigger lens. However, within 5 minutes of turning on the Sony I was pretty well convinced. Having taken this thing to Bora Bora for a week I am absolutely certain it was the right choice, even in spite of the price difference. This camera is fast, it doesn't take much work to get great images out of it, and if you want to take control it has all the settings you'd expect and lots of impressive features to use. The HDR and panorama modes are insane, as are its video capabilities. Video recording has its own physical button, so you can start recording video instantly without changing modes/settings or even looking at the screen first.One potential negative to note is that Sony has gone the Sony way with this camera - proprietary and/or esoteric accessories. The attachment port for the flash is not a standard hot shoe. They call it "Smart Accessory Terminal 2". They'd have to change the shape of the camera to fit a standard one on here. Also the lenses are E-mount type. Again, I think this is b/c they are smaller than standard lenses, but it does limit selection. There's some sort of adapter for regular lenses, but it has limitations (and cost) of it's own. I don't know much about all that since this is my first camera with interchangeable anything on it, which is another thing to note about my review of this product.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Compact camera replacing DSLR
Reviews.Author: Dustin Mcclure
Reviews.Content: The Short:Pro: EXTREMELY FASTAccurate colorsVivid PhotosVery CompactGorgeous Panorma shots.UPDATE: We have had the camera for about a year (give or take a bit) and we still love it. Friends are amazed when they hear our camera go off. One described it as sounding like an automatic rifle going off (not the noise just how fast it was.) Have completely retired our full sized dslr and use this exclusively. Just be warned: you will have to go through a ton of pictures to find that perfect one. When you flip through the pictures on your computer it is similar to watching those old style flip books!Cons:Location of the sd card in the battery well. (We shot 8gigs of photo/video in the course of a day)UPDATE: Opening the battery well does not shut down the camera. I still do not like where the SD card is but I'm just being picky.The compact design makes it a little bit awkward feeling in my hands.When recording video in a quiet environment you pickup the movement of your hands over the stereo mics. In normal operating conditions (normal noise) it does fine.This is an absolutely stunning camera. With a frame rate of 10 per second you will be able to get that shot of your active children. We own a Canon T1I but since getting this we haven't even used it (except to take out the class 10 card.) The colors are amazing, autofocus is amazing and if the camera isn't focusing exactly where you want it to just tap the touchscreen to tell the 5n what to focus on and voila. Definitely user friendly. Would recommend the SanDisk Flash 8 GB SDHC Flash Memory Card SDSDXP1-008G Black no sense in bottle necking the camera at the memory card, remember your buying a $700 digital camera because it's fast.

Reviews.Title: I love it for its intuitive ease of use
Reviews.Author: kikimeow
Reviews.Content: This review is based on the point of view of a novice user.  I wanted a camera that functions well and is portable in a purse. A DSLR is too heavy and I know I won't be able to carry it around when I travel.  I have a Canon S90, which I also love very much for its compact size, however I always wanted a camera that have the ability to yield a nice bokeh.  I don't know how to take a blurry background shots with a point of shoot.  With this camera, it is at ease even with the 18-55mm kit lens.  Just by touching the screen, you can choose where you want to focus on.  For example, I have two kitties one standing closer to me and once further from me.  Just by touching on which ever one I want to focus on, the camera does it automatically.  I don't need to know how to change the settings or do anything special.  It is also as easy to see both kitties clearly if that's the shot you are looking for.  Just have to slide your fingers to focus/defocus.  In addition, the object tracking is just as easy.  Just aim at my kitty and click on a button, the camera then tracks his movement.  You can see the square focus following the kitty around.  I think it is very intuitive, and you really don't have to spend much time learning to use the camera.My other problem with my old camera is taking photo against bright sunlight.  With this camera, in auto mode, the face is not too dark, and the background is not too over exposed.  I can see both the background and the face.  It has a nice balance. I didn't have to deal with adjusting the strength of the flash.It is a big plus for people who wants a step up from point and shoot, yet want a semi-portable camera that's not too heavy.  You do need a medium sized purse, and a sleeve to not damage it.  Also, pick the color of your camera carefully.  The body of a white camera may be beautiful, adding a black lens on it is ugly.

Reviews.Title: Nice high end modal in compact size
Reviews.Author: Caprisun
Reviews.Content: I had a point and shoot which started to give trouble after 4 yrs. I decided to buy a new camera and wanted to upgrade from point and shoot to advanced model. I decided to buy a DSLR camera but didnt like the size. During that time I found this camera and based on the reviews I bought it. Really liked the camera when I started using it. I dont know much about DSLR but this one gives a nice feeling of having an advanced model in compact size. If some is looking to upgrade to advanced model from point and shoot this camera will be a good choice.  I have uploaded a strawberry picture which I took in the product page, this camera really captures great details. But after purchasing one need to spend time to understand its features to make it worth for the price. otherwise just stick with point and shoot. $700 is lot of money for a camera to be used as basic point n shoot these days.

Reviews.Title: ONE OF THE BEST!!!!
Reviews.Author: G. F. THOMAS "fredth"
Reviews.Content: I have Cannon and Nikon SLR's a Cannon 50D and a Nikon D300 And I bought this for the weight and quality of photos. I have never had a camera that I can crop as much detail as this Sony NEX 5N. It is amazing what they have done with such a small camera. Since i have had it I gave it to my partner who loves the size and photos. I purchased a NEX 7 with the 18-200 lens. They both are great cameras!!!  SLR's with a very expensive lens may do more ,but for the cost and quality I think Sony has a winner here by far at this time.

Reviews.Title: Excellent companion camera for a Canon 7D owner
Reviews.Author: Mighty Mouse
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera as it's really fast and the image quality is great.  I was using a Canon S95 as my companion camera before but was totally disappointed with the pictures I took with them.  I sold the S95 and got the NEX 5N.  Even without the flash, this camera performs really well on low light conditions.If you do want to use the flash, here's a nifty way of getting better images.  Cut out a small calling card or any card board and size it to the width of the included flash.  The length would be about 1.5".  Cover it with aluminum foil and tape it to the flash.  This will help bounce the light from the flash up to the ceiling (assuming its a flat ceiling).  The result is you get really good lit images. Why buy the $100 + flash that Sony sells when you can do this and get the same results?Goodluck!

Reviews.Title: Best camera for all-around personal use...
Reviews.Author: J. Kane "AbleKane"
Reviews.Content: I'm a professional photographer and I take my camera EVERYWHERE.  This camera is fantastic!  The military has Nikon D3Xs that I can use at work... but for most jobs that I do it's a bit of overkill.  ANd, the fact that carrying a D3X around all day will wear me out due to the size prompted me to buy this Sony.I've shot with this for about a year and a half and have beat the hell out of it.  Very durable and the quality of photos is fantastic.  You can see my photos online by searching my photo ID number "ZC343".  About 98% of the images you will see with that ID are shot with the Sony NEX 5.I have several lenses for it including the 16mm, 18-55mm, 18-200mm and a fisheye.  I just got the new 55-210mmm and have only used it once.  They all work well with the camera and my favorite is the 18-200.  That lens is expensive, but worth every penny.  Just be careful and don't drop the lens like I did.  I cracked the casing of the lens and now have a bit of dust inside.  The camera, which was attached at the time suffered no damage, thankfully.I highly recommend this camera and will probably buy the NEX 7 within the next 6 months.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Rick
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome. It is light and loaded with features. Good pictures and excellent video capability. After I bought my camera, three of my friends ended up buying one too.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pictures that are easy to take...
Reviews.Author: D. Whitehead
Reviews.Content: I just took a two week trip to India, traveling through Rajasthan and Mumbai.  I had this camera in my hand or slung around my neck constantly.Upsides.This camera proved very easy to use, easy to quickly pull out and take an impromptu shot (camera starts quickly and adjusts settings quickly when on point-and-shoot mode).  It takes high quality pictures (I got this camera for the sole purpose of improving upon the quality of my point and shoot - this more than does the trick).  Has a moderately low profile: the lens is bulky, but the body is slim.  Some professional reviews have dinged it for its small body and the resulting difficulty of holding the camera one-handed.  This may be true for some people, but I have found it very easy to use one-handed.Downsides.The major difficulty is accidentely taking video.  The video starts with a one button push, and is located near frequently used buttons.  My wife and I found it difficult to (a) avoid the video button, and (b) stopping the video once it starts.  This was a minor annoyance - I have not found anything else to not like about this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, but not prefect
Reviews.Author: TonyZ
Reviews.Content: Pros:1. Exceptional color renditionYou will be amazed by how stunning the color rendition in produced images is. It is rich and impressive. With Sony Image Data Convertor, you can make even deeper saturation to make your images more attractive.2. Sharp imagesOf course sharpness heavily depends on what lenses you are using. For most non-Zeiss E-mount lenses, it is pretty sharp. But not razor sharp though, unless you use the E-Mount Carl Zeiss one, or third-party lenses using adapters.3. Rich creative image effectsI think this could one of the sweetest functions that NEX has. Without too much effort, you will be able to take many artistic style images which looks pretty cool.4. Light weightIt makes your life easier when you are traveling. You can even put it in your pocket if you use the 16mmF2.8 'pancake' lens.Cons:1. Serious chromatic aberration in some situationsAs far as I know, the purple fringing happens in lenses of 50mmF1.8, 18-55mmF3.5-5.6, 55-210mm and 16mmF2.0. Not sure about the Carl Zeiss one though. After you shoot images in high-light\high contrast scenarios, don't enlarge your images to see the high contrast edges. The ghostly purple fringes would make you feel disappointed.2. Cumbersome operationsThis is not a real SLR for sure, so you'd better not expect fast & simple operations to set ISO\Aperture\Shutter speed. Usually you would have to go up to 3 levels of menu items to set something up.3. Slow focusNot like real SLRs, it is using Contrast focusing method (I hope I'm using the correct terminology here). It requires longer time to find the correct focus. So just forget instant captures with this camera.4. No viewfinderIt could be really hard to plan a good composition in bright light situations.--In a word, Sony NEX-5N is for ones who take photography for fun only, and who are not pixel-level perfectionist. It is the right choice for semi-professionals. If you expect commercial or competition level pictures, just go for a real SLR.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: GRIFF "-Griffinstein"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera (from RitzCamera) over a year ago before I went on a cruise down to the Mexican Riviera to upgrade from my SLR.  This camera takes very high quality pictures and is fairly light weight and can be stored in any carry on without taking up your whole bag.  I loved the outcome of my panoramic feature (which you can do in 3D) with the arch in Cabo San Lucas.  I also use the camera for some amateur family portraits and never have complaints on the quality.  I am very impressed and am SUPER sastified with this camera.

Reviews.Title: nice camra
Reviews.Author: E. Crandall
Reviews.Content: I had been looking for something better than a point and shoot, but not as big as a conventional DSLR.The good news is it takes great photos.  The standard lens isn't great when you shoot test charts, but it isn't bad for a cheap zoom.  It will be better when there is a better selection of lenses - so far there are only a few and I haven't tried any of them yet.Shutter lag is excellent - this is one of my main issues with digital cameras, so I'm happy,  The user interface works well enough although like every other digital camera I've seen it has its own weirdness.  My largest problem is with the LCD washing out in daylight.  There is an electronic viewfinder available, but it is very expensive.But as I said the photos are great - better than I had expected, so I'm happy.  Apple finally provided RAW compatibility so I'm extra happy.  I would happy recommend this to anyone interested in this class of camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera Except for Critical Flaw - Focus
Reviews.Author: Gadget_Lover
Reviews.Content: I really want to love this camera.  And when I get good focus, I do love it.  The in-focus pictures are gorgeous.  The camera has a very convenient form factor, a good and growing selection of lenses, and a wonderful image sensor that rivals most full size DSLRs.  It is also the best video camera I've ever owned.However, the camera just does not focus reliably in medium-to-low indoor lighting conditions.  As a father of three, my kids are most often my photographic subjects, and that means I'm usually shooting in these less than ideal conditions.  Most recently I took pictures of my daughter's birthday party, which was in a restaurant, and the camera missed focus over half of the time.  This is just not acceptable.I have searched the web for solutions to this problem because, again, I love this camera when it works, and I want the problem to be my fault.  I have found several suggestions for improving the focus, and some of them have resulted in minor improvements, but the bottom line is that autofocus in low light is simply a limitation of the type of focusing system used by this camera.  It is the same system used by camcorders, known as "contrast-detect autofocus," or CDAF.  This is different from "phase-detect autofocus," PDAF, which is used in DSLRs.  With my former Canon DSLR (60D), the autofocus would literally work in a completely dark room (using the assist beam from the flash).  However, the 60D, as with most DSLRs, does not focus during videos, which is why I changed systems.According to some research I've done, micro four third cameras from Panasonic and Olympus have a better CDAF system than the NEX.  However, my understanding is that *all* CDAF systems suffer from this difficulty in focusing in low light situations.  For this reason, I'm selling my NEX and I plan to purchase a Sony SLT camera, which has full-time PDAF, even during movies, thanks to a unique mirror design.So, if you're planning to shoot mainly outdoors, I think this camera is a great choice.  However, if autofocus indoors is important to you, you may want to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: I returned this camera for a clicking sound on the video.
Reviews.Author: Hector
Reviews.Content: The camera does not feel very well made. The picture quality is excellent, but the video has a big flaw: when you are recording video and you move the camera suddenly (like when walking fast, or in a car, etc), it records a clicking sound strong enough to be very well noticed in the final video. It is a shame that Sony has not fixed this problem. I am retuning the camera to Amazon for a refund. I don't recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera . . . BUT . . .
Reviews.Author: Craftsman Woodworks "Clyde Didit"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera primarily for business as I perform inspections for insurance companies.The first weekend I had the camera, I stayed at home playing with all the features it offered and was blown away with all it could do.  I thought it was the best camera I had ever owned.Then reality set in and I found out it will only put a date stamp on a photo if you PRINT the photo.  Sony's logic is that it ruins a photograph.Unfortunately, the companies to which I send my photo files want to see a date.  The only other option is to add a date manually using digital photo software and can only be done one photo at a time.Also, as other reviews mention, the battery drains faster than an F-22 Raptor on afterburner.So, if you don't mind buying an extra battery or two and can live without a date stamp this is a great camera!

Reviews.Title: No clicks!!
Reviews.Author: Alan Edwards
Reviews.Content: Just got mine, from BB. No clicking on my unit. Yes a little small if you have large hands, but am looking for a hand sling to take care of that.Potential of the camera is huge with the ability to use any lens with an inexpensive adapter. That for me is what sealed the deal. All my other cameras will go to eBay ASAPAnyway big relief that my unit is not clicking!

Reviews.Title: Great little DSLR
Reviews.Author: A. Ozkul
Reviews.Content: This camera can be used as a point and shoot or DSLR. For quick-and-dirty picture taking, I bought a 30mm Sigma lens which produced very sharp pictures. Then, I bought an adapter ($20) to use Minolta and Sony lenses, and now I have a great DSLR with so many Minolta and Sony lens sets availability. Great fun camera! Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera
Reviews.Author: Pernell Cox
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing. The picture quality is phenomenal. An amateur can pick up this device and begin taking great photos.I will not pretend I'm an expert and recite specifications or my personal stress test. Once dimension that can use improvement is the continuous shooting feature. At times, it takes the camera a bit too long to process an image which means you can potentially miss a good shot in the sequence.The point and shoot features on this camera is top notch and the DSLR features are competitive to the more professional Canon and Nikon units.

Reviews.Title: wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Ian Mcfarland
Reviews.Content: Recommend you get the Sony aftermarket flash but this blows the doors off the full size camera out there in half the size video is amazing.,

Reviews.Title: Absolutely best camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Howard Green
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have more expensive, higher megapixel cameras, but they don't give me better around the house pictures of my daughter.  The automantic iso setting allows this camera to go to 3200 iso and at that setting it gets really nice low light pictures. The 24 megapixel cameras that I have give me more noise at 3200 and less good images in low light.  There are settings for the amount of sharpness, and saturation you want in your pictures that allow even experienced photographers to get the pictures the way they want them.  But there are also some very user friendly approaches for beginners that will give you really good pictures.The flash that comes with it is clip on, and not very good, and it comes off, so I lost mine. But on the other side, this camera's low light pictures are so good, you usually don't need a flash.

Reviews.Title: Compact DSLR. great image and video quality
Reviews.Author: Patrick M,
Reviews.Content: one of the best camera i used. very high image quality specially at low light. video is very good. 1080p.

Reviews.Title: Solid camera!
Reviews.Author: Adnan Rehmatullah
Reviews.Content: Big fan. We had the Nikon D5100 but we wouldn't take it anywhere because of the size. You are more likely to use a smaller camera than a bulky one. Picture quality is equivalent.

Reviews.Title: Best purchase ever.
Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: So I spent weeks looking at cameras, going to different stores, trying various cameras out, and also asking around.I ended up stumbling upon this one and haven't looked back.The interface is extremely friendly, and it pumps out awesome pictures without much effort. This was my first DSLR/micro four thirds/whatever you want to call it camera, so it's been great at helping me learn the basics.If you are a more skilled photographer and love easily adjusting all of the different settings, then this might not be for you though. Most of the settings are buried in 1 or 2 layers, and if you are constantly adjusting, I could see how this might get annoying.

Reviews.Title: CAMERA OUT OF THIS WORLD
Reviews.Author: Rab Banerjee
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA WAS GIVEN THE GOLD STATUS BY DP REVIEW. A CAMERA THAT YOU COULD TAKE WITH YOU WHERE SOEVER YOU GO. ALSO STRIKING PICTURES.

Reviews.Title: One of the best mirror-less cameras at the moment
Reviews.Author: volodoscope "Artist by heart, geek by nature"
Reviews.Content: Sony came out on top. Beats Nikon crappy ONE and Canon's unimaginative PowerShots.Camera feels great in hands when holding. It's not cheaply made. I love Sony's industrial design language, which also carries out to the user interface. The touch-screen is nice but I prefer using the hard butons next to it.Photo quality is also up to the standard to entry level DSLR. Really like all the different settings available. I had two different lenses and changing them is a bliss. Camera fits in all bags and when with the pancake lens, it fits even better.Really happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: The best camera I have ever used
Reviews.Author: Serge Callens "callens@mgmt.purdue.edu"
Reviews.Content: Granted I have only had point and shoot before but now that I have an active daughter that does not like to sit still for pictures, I decided to get this camera.  And I must say that this is a great camera in a small package, it does take some time to get used to taking pictures with this camera as there is a learning curve.  Ofcourse you can put it on auto but I have found that tinkering with it usually gives you a bit more control over the end result.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Knerq
Reviews.Content: This is my first DSLR camera and even without taking a class I have been able to take some really AMAZING pictures. It's not too heavy and not too big so it fits in my purse - which means I have it with me a lot and have gotten a lot of use out of it. Easily taken over a thousand photos since June. The flash is sold separately for a very good reason - 99% photos do not need it! The picture quality is fantastic. Glad I purchased a 32 MB memory card - and cloud storage. Those are the accessories that you really need! Only two minor complaints: the lens cap is separate and I'm always in fear of losing it; the camera makes a noise with every picture so the panoramic photos are a little noisy.

Reviews.Title: A very good producer of quality snap shots
Reviews.Author: Bang-for-the-buck "Jim"
Reviews.Content: Easy to pick up and fire when the moment strikes. Shoots very well in low-light conditions. Has better than average image clarity and color reproduction.You can read an in-depth review of it @ DPReview.com

Reviews.Title: Perfect stuff~
Reviews.Author: Amethyst
Reviews.Content: I love this product, it's easy to carry, and good quality pic it take. many modes to choose can make more effects

Reviews.Title: Great and compact!
Reviews.Author: chad
Reviews.Content: This takes beautiful pictures. Much loved by me. I even took it on safari in Uganda Africa And got amazing pictures!

Reviews.Title: My prayers have been answered! Point and shoot cam.with DSLR features/ qualities!
Reviews.Author: Mrs.Echon
Reviews.Content: I am only a hobbyist photographer but an absolute lover of fine photography. I would like to even admit that I have a good eye! And so,being both stated...I definetely needed a hand held camera,but one that would allow me to transfer beauty into DSLR quality photographs. It was literally love at first sight with the Sony Nex 5N and I. My favorite feauture in all cameras is the macro setting. This camera produces outstanding images,adding great depth and breath into pictures. Obviously, I do not understand a photographer's language,but pictures say a thousand words. If you are a hobbyist like me,you will love all the things this camera can do! I already own a big,bulky,heavy weighted SLR camera...but this DSLR is actually so much better in so many aspects. It's lighter to carry on a daily basis. Always nice to be able to shoot anything that may inspire you,so it's way more convenient to carry a smaller,sleek camera like this. I decided to just go all out and ordered the other lenses. I bought this camera for my little family,so that we could record our new life with vivid,long-lasting pictures. I was astonished by how this camera can recognize a baby,haha! I told you,I'm just a regular photography lover! I have many more things to learn about this camera. But,so far....the Gods have answered my prayers and practically laid this camera on my lap! I love it more than my Pentax DSLR! Will keep updating my review as I discover more good things about this camera! One more thing,so glad I didn't go for the Nikon 1 J1 with only 10.1 MP! This is wayyyyyyyy more delicious and worth breaking my piggy bank!

Reviews.Title: I would give 4.5 stars if I could
Reviews.Author: JW
Reviews.Content: Overall this camera is a hit! Image quality is good, though not as good as my dSLR.  The video quality is better than his dSLR.  This camera does a nice job auto focusing during video.  The reason why I would give 4.5 stars is that it is hard to use. Options are buried in menus, sometimes the touch screen is an option to use, sometimes not.  I have owned point and shoots and SLRs, and never have I come across a camera that is so hard to change settings.

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera
Reviews.Author: K. Hirsch
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera - it seems to be the perfect step up from a point-and-shoot for my mom.  She wanted something faster and it also has he bonus of being a great camera.  Barely ever needs a flash (which is good, since you have to put it on to use it.). As all of the professional site reviews say, it is quirky and not always intuitive.  I was dismayed last night to see that it stores pictures and videos separately - which is annoying when you have to figure out how to get in the right folder to review on board and also when you want to download them.  I had to download the stills in iPhoto and then go into iMovie to deal with the movie - and make it into a useable clip.  Overall, the good should outweigh the bad, but they really need to work on that user interface.

Reviews.Title: User Friendly
Reviews.Author: cnerker90
Reviews.Content: This Camera is so amazing. I've never had an SLR camera, and now i finally have a step down from a full size SLR  with the compactness of a smaller camera. Takes great pictures. Easy to use on screen instructions for those who need extra help.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - some of the best pictures - flash lousy
Reviews.Author: Gordon
Reviews.Content: Replacing a Canon G10. Wow - amazing pictures. Especially at low-light pictures - the larger sensor really makes a difference. Also, Sony has spent a bunch of time tuning the auto-exposure to get good pictures in low light. No small camera I've owned has ever gotten the exposure right - I almost always have to use EV adjustments or switch to full manual mode to get thigns like christmas lights or fireworks correctly exposed. The auto setting on this camera does really well!One thing to watch for - this has a seperate lens cap. Takes a little getting used to again. :-)One bad thing: the flash is awful. It isn't strong (which is expected), but it also doesn't stay attached to the camera - pops off very easily. As a result I often just don't use it.

Reviews.Title: "VALUE FOR MONEY" - Best camera below 1200 usd
Reviews.Author: Rajat Tandon
Reviews.Content: I have compared this camera against all mid range SLRs and and it outshines all of them in picture quality.Top FeaturePicture qualityspeed the picture moment will be never missedVideo is awsomeease of useLCD touch screenISO sensitivityLighthandysmall sizeeasy to carryEndless excellent feature ."VALUE FOR MONEY"

Reviews.Title: Sold My Canon T3i...
Reviews.Author: Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu "xbmrx"
Reviews.Content: Originally bought the T3i before I decided to sell at the suggestion of one of my buddy's (who also purchased one & has a Canon 5d Mark x as well). One of his close friends is a professional photographer & said that when they're not on a job, this is the camera they carry at all times. Sensor is a bit larger than the T3i, FPS for continuous shooting is MUCH faster, ISO/Low-Light performance is AMAZING (rarely ever use the flash), etc... Camera was purchased primarily for indoor shooting (daughter's theatre performances, etc...) so per his recommendation, the 5n is considered a no brainer in my case. (not to mention the ridiculous reviews & GOLD rating from dpreview). I figure if/when I go back to a Canon DSLR, I'll go with a full frame next time around anyway to take advantage of the L-Series lenses (Stock 18-55 was GARBAGE).Additionally, this was a recent purchase & I DID NOT have the clicking issue when recording video. (whew!)Highly recommend...

Reviews.Title: A fun toy
Reviews.Author: escalation
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to have some fun and it delivers. the camera is so slim which make it possible to use almost any lens with adapter. tried contax c/y and nikon and the peaking feature is awesome. jpg quality is totally usable.I also like the toy camera, the HDR and the buildin panorama features.I am putting my dslr on eb.. now.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera concept but you need to know the downsides before you buy
Reviews.Author: R. Siegfried
Reviews.Content: I bought this because it has a full size sensor in a small camera. From what I can tell so far it produces a fantastic, bright,clear image and is easy to use.If you use the intelligent mode it will take photos with little or no thinking required as if it was a point and shoot. If you wish to get more hands on you can use a variety of manual modes for more control.It can easily produce shots with a crisp sharp focus on your subject and the desired amount of blur in the background or foreground. To someone like myself its handling of low light and high contrast is amazing, producing great  bright clear photos in difficult situations. If you get the 16mm lens you can fit it in a large pocket. The battery life is quite good. I have heard complaints but I have none at all. You will need to get the Genuine Sony battery which is the same as the $8.00 one but has a code in its program. Now here is what you need to know.Most important to me was the fact that I could not register or obtain support online without giving Sony a primary email address from one of the major carriers. I use  use Hotmail and others and could not register. They will spam the email address heavily so be careful. I was able to register by phone. The red lamp for the auto focus is positioned where I would normally grip the camera. It can't be helped. This is a small camera. The auto focus has trouble focusing with this covered. I needed to develop a grip that did not press any buttons or cover the lamp.The shutter sound cannot be silenced, probably because it is mechanical, so candid photos are tricky.It cannot shoot stills while recording movies.The flash unit becalm erratic after a while and Sony is sending a new one free. Overall am very positive about this camera. There are a few complaints to overcome not the lest of which is Sony's refusal to provide support if you have the wrong email provider but overall it is well worth it.
